alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 8:36AM CDT until July 03 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Union County in south central Arkansas... Northeastern Columbia County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until noon CDT. * At 836 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... El Dorado, Norphlet, Strong, Calion, Lawson, Urbana, Lisbon, Lapile, Mount Holly, Village, Felsenthal, Kenova, Pigeon Hill, New London, Medlock and Ebenezer. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
